## Task 1: Reproducing and improving figures


### Figure 3
```{r figure-3}
#Figure 3 Data Wrangling
fig3_raw <- hiit_ppd_raw %>% 
  mutate(
    group_code = `Intervention group`,
    epds = as.numeric(`Edinburg Postnatal Depression Scale Score`)
  ) %>% 
  select(group_code, epds)

# Data Classification
fig3_raw <- fig3_raw %>% 
  mutate(
    group = case_when(
      group_code == 1 ~ "HIIT",
      group_code == 2 ~ "EDU",
      TRUE ~ NA_character_
    ),
    epds_cat = case_when(
      is.na(epds) ~ NA_character_,
      epds < 10 ~ "<10",
      epds >= 10 & epds <= 11 ~ "10-11",
      epds >= 12 ~ "≥12"
    ),
    epds_cat = factor(epds_cat, levels = c("<10", "10-11", "≥12"))
  ) %>% 
  filter(!is.na(group), !is.na(epds_cat)) # exclude NAs

fig3_sum <- fig3_raw %>% 
  count(group, epds_cat) %>% 
  group_by(group) %>% 
  mutate(
    pct = n / sum(n),
    label = paste0(round(pct * 100, 1), "%")
  ) %>% 
  ungroup()

# Figure Representation
ggplot(fig3_sum, aes(
  x = factor(group,
             levels = c("EDU", "HIIT"),
             labels = c("EDU - Educational Intervention Group",
                        "HIIT - High Intensity Interval Training Group")), 
  y = pct, 
  fill = epds_cat)
  ) +
  geom_col(width = 0.25, position = position_stack(reverse = TRUE)) +
  coord_flip() +
  scale_y_continuous(
    limits = c(0, 1),
    breaks = seq(0, 1, 0.1),
    labels = function(x) sprintf("%.2f%%", x * 100)
  ) +
  scale_fill_discrete(labels = c(
    "<10" = "range indicating the norm (below 10 points)",
    "10-11" = "slightly increased severity of PPD symptoms (10-11 points)",
    "≥12" = "increased severity of PPD symptoms (12 or more points"
  ))+
  labs(
    x = NULL,
    y = NULL,
    fill = NULL
  ) +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 12) +
  theme(
    legend.position = "bottom",
    legend.direction = "vertical",
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank()
  )
```
